{"step_by_step_thinking": "Creep is the slow deformation of a material under a constant stress. In the context of dental materials, creep rate refers to the slow change in shape of a material under constant stress. The creep rate would decrease with a decrease in the force of condensation, as less force would result in less stress on the material, and thus less deformation.", "answer_choice": "B.
